instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no backlight
threads.message:
Got a 2915 with no image no backlight no external display. my guess is the GFX is dying/dead, and if its not it will soon be anyway,  so wanting to try a Gmux flash for the first time, getting this error on lattice programmer below: so my guess is that the jtag scan came up empty because it failed to read <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>?

initially i measured that i didn't have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> and i had <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> and lazy to go on troubleshooting. should i replace <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>? if yes can it be from anyboard? if no what can i do next

Device#1 LFXP2-5E: Failed to verify the ID
(Expected: 0x01299043 Read: 0x00000000).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no backlight
threads.message:
Did you remove L2406, or <RESISTOR>R2415</RESISTOR>?
Before connecting Lattice Diamond programmer...

You also must remove one of <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11, before starting the machine; once GMUX has been reflashed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no backlight
threads.message:
okay, using back the same thread as i just received another mac same model which does this.
Boots up apple logo with spinning wheel, about 15 seconds later, shuts down. but stays on when no HDD is plugged in. I read that this is the classic bad GPU issue on this model
Would DeMux solve this issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no backlight
threads.message:
As simple as try it.

I suppose machine stays on without HDD because doesn't try to load the GPU driver.
You can try with Linux/Windows Live USB.
